{{coord|18|26|36.00|N| 67|8|50.00|W|region:US_type:landmark|display=title}} {{Infobox Radio station | name = WELX | image = | city = [[Isabela, Puerto Rico|Isabela]], [[Puerto Rico]] | area = Puerto Rico | slogan = | branding = ''La X'' | frequency = 101.5 [[MHz]] | repeater = | airdate = | share = 0.4 | share as of = Wi'08 | share source = R&R{{cite news | first= | last= | coauthors= | title=Puerto Rico Market Ratings | date= | url=http://www.radioandrecords.com/RRRatings/DefaultSearch.aspx?MarketName=Puerto%20Rico&MarketRank=%20 | work =[[Radio & Records]] | pages = | language = }} | format = [[Top 40]] | power = | erp = 50,000 [[watt]]s | haat = 129.0 meters | class = B | facility_id = 29219 | coordinates = {{coord|18|26|36.00|N| 67|8|50.00|W|region:US_type:city}} | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = WKSA-FM (1979-2009) | owner = La Equis Broadcasting Corp. | licensee = | sister_stations = WXYX-FM, WXLX-FM | webcast = | website = http://www.lax.fm | affiliations = }} '''WELX''' (101.5 [[FM broadcasting|FM]]) is a [[radio station]] broadcasting a [[Top 40]] format. Licensed to [[Isabela, Puerto Rico]], the station serves the Puerto Rico area. The station is currently owned by La Equis Broadcasting Corp. {{cite web|url=http://www.fcc.gov/fcc-bin/fmq?call=WELX |title=WELX Facility Record |work=United States [[Federal Communications Commission]], audio division }}{{cite web|url=http://www1.arbitron.com/sip/displaySip.do?surveyID=SU08&band=fm&callLetter=WELX|title=WELX Station Information Profile|publisher=[[Arbitron]]}} ==References==
